New Records: The Chicago Cubs have now scored 5+ runs in 12 straight road games, setting a new franchise record last achieved in July-August 1889.
Key Match Events: The Chicago Cubs offense pounded out 11 hits and hit three home runs, with Michael Busch contributing two and Pete Crow-Armstrong one, marking his 10th home run of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: The Chicago Cubs' offensive explosion is too little, too late as they remain 5.0 games back in the National League wild card race.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Coors Field, known for its high elevation aiding offensive performances.
